security: Disclosing Indonesian communications, even if old, could reveal intelligence-gathering capabilities or sources and methods. The document is marked SECRET and advises HANDLE VIA COMINT CHANNELS ONLY.
summary: An NSA document containing intercepted Indonesian naval communications regarding flags being flown at half-mast to honor the late President John F. Kennedy, along with a correction message.
summary_one_paragraph: This NSA document, dated November 24 and 25, 1963, consists of intercepted Indonesian naval communications (COMINT) concerning directives to fly flags at half-mast as a sign of respect for the deceased President John F. Kennedy. The messages include the original order from the Naval C-in-C to various naval commands and ships, followed by a correction message amending the title and reference number of the initial communication. The document is classified as SECRET and intended to be handled via COMINT channels only.
title: Flags at Half-Mast
